summary: Far in the future, after an apocalyptic conflict has devastated much of the world's ecosystem, the few surviving humans live in scattered semi-hospitable environments within what has become a "toxic jungle." Young Nausicaä lives in the arid Valley of the Wind and can communicate with the massive insects that populate the dangerous jungle. Under the guidance of the pensive veteran warrior, Lord Yupa, Nausicaä works to bring peace back to the ravaged planet.

reviews.content: the first 45 minutes are a but slow but after that my eyes were glued the screen, definitely a underratted studio ghibli movie

The story is pretty good although a bit heavy handed with what the audience is supposed to take away. The animation is wonderful and voice acting cast is top tier. A strong start for a still-forming Studio Ghibli.
Absolute masterpiece great world building lovable characters and amazing plot

As dirty, cruel, forest-cutting, oil-burning, roadkill-making monsters, we don't deserve this film. Nausicaä is a champion of nature the likes we rarely see in fiction or reality. The animation is stellar, the characters are phenomenal, and the the premise transcends words. The world would be a utopia of life, peace, and happiness if everyone had even one tenth the compassion Nausicaä has for the planet and all of Mother Earth's daughters and sons big and small alike.

I thought the movie like most Studio Ghibli had a cool premise but so boring in execution. the movie either over-explains things or just doesn't explain things at all. The main character was insufferable at times and is the only one who is smart or capable. the movie spoils the ending in the first 15 because of its painfully obvious foreshadowing. It's bad storytelling when you say that there is going to be someone that wears blue and will save us AND YOUR MAIN CHARACTER WEARS BLUE THE WHOLE TIME.

I loved the concept and story of the movie, but the execution could have been a bit better. At times it felt like the movie and its characters didn't take their situation seriously enough which ruined some of my suspension disbelief. However, I feel like this is a common aspect in most anime so I am trying to not to fault it too much.

Not the best plot or characters or worldbuilding. Not to mention the off-putting choice of making the main character's tights almost indistinguishable from her skin, and constantly having her dress fly up.

Pretty great, though not a fan of pRoPhEcIeS and the antiindustrialism.
Good message with pacifism/non-aggression and empathy.
Magical and meaningful: Suspenseful story (even for adults!) with wonderful messaging for the environment and against war (for kids and adults!), gorgeously animated.

This reminded me of Pixar's Inside Out in that it was so original and creative that it was rather hard to really engage with as I didn't have much to compare or relate it to. I enjoyed the individual ingredients (incredibly detailed animation, strong female protagonist, the score) but I can't say I was particularly moved when taking it in as a whole. My favorite parts were the glider scenes and picking out which voice actors I recognized in the Disney dub.
must watch for all animation fan, one of Miyazaki's best.
NAUSICAÄ is better, there is a sad scene and my favorite character. just my problem: Who happened to the characters? by the death? there is blood and it makes no sense. Well I give it 10 to 10

There's an argument to made that it's a tad overrated, yes it boasts the gorgeous visuals and unique world building that's a hallmark of Miyazaki's best work, but the themes get a little too heavy handed. Anyway I'm probably just nitpicking, the finale does have some great moments and it's positive ending seems earned.

Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind is an imaginative nightmarish adventure from its forlorn apocalyptic wasteland to the designs of fictional creatures like the giant pill-bug insect like the Ohm that is expressed with it's stunning animation blended with Hayao Miyazaki's direction mixed with optimism of our main or side characters living in this world, notably Nausicaä herself (Sumi Shimamoto) who is a delight to see on screen, gives audiences a haunting experience from beginning to end. While the film has some verbose dialogue and several storylines and characters that aren't fully developed, it's still worth watching if you enjoy fantasy films.
The animation is insignificant here as the script created is tremendous. The scenes of giant beetles comes to my mind almost always. 8/10

This is a beautiful, under-appreciated Miyazaki movie. It is similar to Castle in the Sky and Ponyo with gorgeous animation and a strong plot about caring for nature.
100% worth watching. It is awesome, especially for Miyazaki fans but great for anyone who enjoys animation and a great family/kid movie.

A mix of Dune meets Fern Gully.  Towards the end started to loose some of my concentration as its rather long, but overall I enjoyed it. Great animation and story. Liked that the girl was the hero of the story. A sci-fi Studio Ghibli, would like to see it as a live action remake.
